title: Fix Java 5 compilation problem.
body:
Remove @Override from compare(Method, Method) because Java 5 doesn't
support @Override for implementations of interface methods. You need
Java 6 for this.

title: Add names for parameterized tests. Fixes #24 and #44.
body:
In order that you can easily identify individual test, you may provide a name for the Parameters annotation.
 @Parameters(name="my test")
This name is allowed to contain placeholders, which are replaced at runtime. The placeholders are
* {index} - the current parameter index
* {0} - the first parameter
* {1} - the second parameter
* ... - the other parameters
If you don't use the name parameter, then the current parameter index is used as name.

Example:
When you use @Parameters(name="fib({0})={1}") with the Fibonacci example, then you get test names like "fib(3)=2".

This feature is based on the work of Dimitar Dimitrov (pull request#145). Thank you.

title: @BeforeClass of superclass is not executed
Potential ConcurrentModificationException in RunNotifier.SafeNotifier
If @Before throws an exception, then @After of the other subclasses should not be executed
body:
Hi,

I have 3 classes such that A extends from B which extends from C. Each one of them have a @Before and @After block. If @Before block in C actually throws an exception, then @After blocks from A and B should not be executed and only @After block from C should be executed. 
In my particular case, I was creating a folder in @Before and in @After writing a file in the folder in class B. Now since @Before at C threw an exception, @Before of B did not get executed but it executed @After of B which caused another exception as the folder it expected did not exists.
What do you suggest?

Regards,

Vignesh

title: Don't remove listeners, which throw exceptions (fixes #209 and #395)
Junit | Can we add @Inherited to org.junit.experimental.categories.Category annotation
body:
Hi,

We use junit 4.10 along with maven-surefire-plugin. For running all integration tests that belong to a particular category. without @Inherited annotation in org.junit.experimental.categories.Category, maven-surefire-plugin requires each test case to be annotated individually.

It would be great to have the support of running all test cases that extend the parent class which has a specified category annotation ,  instead of requiring each test class to have that category annotation.

I agree that changes can be made at surefire-plugin side to explicitly look for the annotation in the parent class, submitted a patch to surefire-plugin for the same: https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/SUREFIRE-829 , but things will be cleaner if @Inherited is added to Category class in junit itself.

What are the disadvantages of this approach ? (If Category annotation is used only for grouping tests, this would be a good approach. Wouldnt it? )

Can you please let me know which one is better ?

Thanks,
Gayathri

title: Adding support for marking Tests as Blocked
body:
Coming from Android Testing Framework and mobile development there are many tests that are dependent on a certain environment or configuration. Often the status of dependencies vary and it would very useful to mark tests as blocked because some precondition is not met. Many testing tools have this wider range of test result status that can be used. 

I have created an initial commit that would solve this problem. However if this concept is accepted I think that the patched should be redesigned so that you have a class called TestHalted (or something) that TestBlocked, TestError and TestFailure inherit from. Then each of these classes should also be responsible for their result text when producing the printout instead of hard coded values.

Further I think that if this new status is introduced Assume should not mark Tets as Ignored but rather Blocked. To me it feels strange that you have started executing a test then halt it but mark it as Igonred. I think that @Ignore is the correct way of
removing Tests from the scope.

please see:
https://github.com/cafebabe-applications/junit/commit/e9ccdea1144c501ce24512d61fb9fb9c7bad2d8f

title: Junit | Category | Accept string value instead of class
body:
Hi,

I am using junit 4.9 along with maven surefire plugin for running test cases belonging to a particular group.
Similar to testng, can we have junit category accept string values in addition to/instead of just classes ?

This is creating problem when we have a multi module maven based project and we define plugin config in the parent pom, the category class mentioned in the parent pom wouldnt have loaded yet and throws ClassNotFoundException.

Else, we will have to repeat the plugin config in all the sub-modules which is redundant.
Are there any advantages of accepting a class instead of String in org.junit.experimental.categories.Category ?

Thanks,
Gayathri

title: Adding support for marking a Test as blocked.
body:
Previously there were only two expected outcomes
from a Test, passed or failed. If some precondition was not met
that was not part of the actual test it could only by failed.
With this patch user can now call:

Assert.block() or Assert.block(message) to stop execution of test
and mark it as blocked. The individual test result will now be a B
instead of F. The overall summary will also show the total number
of blocked Tests.

title: In Java 5 @Override is not allowed on interface implementations
body: Fix for incompatibility introduced in #293.

title: Remove uncompilable @Override
body: https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/pull/293/files#r587424 for background.

title: Upgrade to Hamcrest 1.3
body:
- Matchers in JUnitMatchers that are now provided by hamcrest-core are deprecated.
- The static methods now delegate to CoreMatchers
- The four Matcher classes copied from Hamcrest have been deleted.
- Using CoreMatchers where possible

*Important:*
In some but not all cases, this change will cause compile errors for people
using JUnitMatchers.hasItem(s), both(), and either().

Merging this pull request would fix #36.

title: Allow creation of Description with a unique id. Needed for Cucumber-JVM.
body:
This patch implements the solution suggested by @dsaff in #184. It is needed to fix cucumber/cucumber-jvm#225.

### For Cucumber-JVM hackers:
To try this out in Cucumber-JVM, build JUnit and install it into your local Maven repo with:

```
mvn install:install-file -Dfile=junit4.11-SNAPSHOT/junit-4.11-SNAPSHOT.jar -DgroupId=junit -DartifactId=junit -Dversion=4.11.DESCRIPTION_FIX -Dpackaging=jar
```

Then build Cucumber-JVM's `unique-junit-descriptions` branch.

title: org.junit.rules.Timeout should accept a long value
body:
Timeout values are usually long values, so there should be a constructor, that supports a long value for the Timeout. 
Currently I have to do things like the following:

new Timeout((int) DateUtils.MILLIS_PER_MINUTE * 5)

which is not very nice...

title: Using @RunWith on a TestCase does not start setUp()
body:
Generally,  using the @Runwith annotation on a TestCase, the TestCase.setUp() method is not called any longer.
Even using @RunWith(BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.class), which is declared to be the default runner for JUnit 4, doesn't launch those methods.
I tried this in JUnit 4.10 and 4.8.2.
Is there any workaround?

title: Drop any jUnit 3.8 packaging
body:
Every once in a while a developer or the eclipse IDE will default to the 3.8 junit packaging for the Assert function, using junit.framework.Assert and not  org.junit.Assert.

Can these duplicates be removed at some point ? Sure it will reduce backwards compatibility, but people do need to move on at some point.

title: Allow create suite which automagically seek test methods
Build Documentation: Needs More Details
body:
I am new at all of this and I have compiled JUnit from source code.  How do I install it?  I ran the "ant dist" without errors on the git version, but what is the equivalent of "make install"?

Please add this to the BUILD text file.  Thanks.

title: RunNotifier.pleaseStop() is now thread-safe
Make ClassRequest memoize the runner.
body:
Creating the runner can be an expensive operation. Other types of requests
are written in such a way that the runner is already memoized.

title: TemporaryFolder.newFile should fail if file already exists
body: If I am mistakenly call TemporaryFolder.newFile twice with the same filename (in a single test), I expect the second invocation to throw an exception, as a file by that name already exists (so no "new fresh file" as the javadoc so aptly puts it can be created). Instead (in junit 4.10), it succeeds and simply returns a File object pointing to the existing file.

title: handling null in error messages
body:
1. Style issues in the "failSame" and "failNotSame" methods: in each method three code lines can be replaced with one line. (The proposed change doesn't address an inconsistency in appending space to empty messages in "failSame" and "failNotSame" but not in "format".)

2. A small performance issue in "assertNull": there's no need to append strings when the object is null. (We found several tests to run slow because of unnecessary string appending.)

title: Addressing some style and performance issues with null error messages.
body:
1. Style issues in the "failSame" and "failNotSame" methods: in each method three code lines can be replaced with one line. (The proposed change doesn't address an inconsistency in appending space to empty messages in "failSame" and "failNotSame" but not in "format".)

2. A small performance issue in "assertNull": there's no need to append strings when the object is null. (We found several tests to run slow because of unnecessary string appending.)

title: Fixed issue #219 (rebased)
body: Fixed issue #219 where Assert.assertArrayEquals(float[],float[],float) displays an error message with doubles instead of floats. I rebased my changes as you requested.

title: Sweep through unfixed warnings
Issue 22: Adding assertNotEquals to Object, long and double
body:
Created a new pull request for the issue 22.
Previous (https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/pull/277) will be closed.

title: Make TemporaryFolder.createFile fail if the file already exists (Fixes #413)
body: I've added a check on the return code of File.createNewFile to throw an IllegalStateException if the file already exists. I believe this is the smallest change that fixes the original issue. Some tests are included to verify the new behaviour.

title: The "fix" for issue 413 is breaking Apache Commons Configuration.
body: Apache Gump is trying to build Apache Commons Configuration using the latest Junit and is failing due to this "fix". Commons Configuration calls newFile twice in a unit test to test file reloading. The second call is now throwing an IllegalSteteException where before the test did exactly what was desired.

title: Relocate Maven artifact "junit-dep" to "junit"
body:
- The junit-dep JARs are now deployed as junit:junit into the Maven repository.
- The junit:junit-dep artifact only consists of a POM pointing to junit:junit now.

Merging this would fix #332.
